poem:
Title: "Wild West Cantata"

Python's enigma, turned bel canto,
Stetsons thrown in a low-budget fiasco.
Charles Court Opera's playful safari,
Into the whimsy of late-Victorian parti.

Gilbert, Sullivan, now a wild western ride,
With Rossini's score a raucous guide.
Barber of Seville, in land of the free,
An opera of chaos, a cacophony.
prompt: You are the poet Simon Armitage. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Barber of Seville review – high energy, whimsy and Stetsons as Rossini goes to the wild west Imagine the Monty Python team making a foray into bel canto. Or perhaps a Carry On special set in an opera company with little budget but a ready source of Stetsons. Charles Court Opera’s home turf is the late-Victorian middlebrow silliness of Gilbert and Sullivan, but the company occasionally ventures into other comic opera. In this outing directed". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
